ResumeData.ProfessionalSummary:
I believe in hard work and integrity. I am committed to my work. I am an optimist and
a perfectionist. I don t give up until I achieve the objectives met.
ResumeData.Objective:
To achieve the best out of my potential as a Teacher, Educational Researcher,
Manager and Planner so that the society obtains both qualitative and quantitative
education. To apply research knowledge to solve challenges faced by the educational
sector in Kenya and globally. To disseminate research findings in available fora and
to prepare quality materials for teacher education and for training educational
managers.

Findings.Message: You should not use the PDF format for your resume. Due to inherent limitations with text extraction from PDFs, you are less likely to get a job when using a PDF resume.
Each section type should only appear once in a resume.
Every degree in a resume should have a name or type associated with it, such as 'B.S.' or 'M.S.'.
Every degree in a resume should be associated with a school.
High school (or lower) education should not be included on resumes that contain higher-level education.
Your resume includes a References section. References should NEVER be included in a resume.

The following section was identified as a skills section type: 'COMPUTER KNOWLEDGE'. Skills should not be in a separate section, but instead, each skill should be included in the descriptions of work history or education. THIS IS INCREDIBLY IMPORTANT FOR AI MATCHING ALGORITHMS
Marital status should not be included in a resume (for most cultures).
Multiple email addresses were found in the contact information. Only one email address should be included in a resume.
Every section should have a clear, unambiguous, commonly-used header on a separate line directly above the content associated with it.

CURRICULUM VITAE

(a)	PERSONAL DETAILS

Name: James MuriithiIreri
Address: University of Nairobi, CHS
P.o Box 19676, Nairobi
• telephone: Cell Phone 0722 880 984
• e-mail: jmireri@uonbi.ac.ke or jimireri@yahoo.com
Gender: Male
Nationality: Kenyan
Languages Spoken: English, Kiswahili and Kiembu
Marital Status: Married
Next of Kin: Wamuyu Muriithi
P.oBox 1176, EMBU
Tel. 0724-77 10 28


(b)	CAREER OBJECTIVES
To achieve the best out of my potential as a Teacher, Educational Researcher,
Manager and Planner so that the society obtains both qualitative and quantitative
education. To apply research knowledge to solve challenges faced by the educational
sector in Kenya and globally. To disseminate research findings in available fora and
to prepare quality materials for teacher education and for training educational
managers.

(c)	PERSONAL STATEMENT
I believe in hard work and integrity. I am committed to my work. I am an optimist and
a perfectionist. I don t give up until I achieve the objectives met.

(i)	PROFFESIONAL ACHIEVEMENTS

to mark Diploma Teacher Education (DTE) education Examination.

Ireri s CV

integration in Teaching and Learning. Topics covered included:
Introduction to Computers, Ms Word Processing, Ms Power point, Ms
Excel and internet.

computer proficiency course which covered: Introduction to computers,
ms word and Internet.

Findings.Message: You should not use the PDF format for your resume. Due to inherent limitations with text extraction from PDFs, you are less likely to get a job when using a PDF resume.
Each section type should only appear once in a resume.
Every degree in a resume should have a name or type associated with it, such as 'B.S.' or 'M.S.'.
Every degree in a resume should be associated with a school.
High school (or lower) education should not be included on resumes that contain higher-level education.
Your resume includes a References section. References should NEVER be included in a resume.

The following section was identified as a skills section type: 'COMPUTER KNOWLEDGE'. Skills should not be in a separate section, but instead, each skill should be included in the descriptions of work history or education. THIS IS INCREDIBLY IMPORTANT FOR AI MATCHING ALGORITHMS
Marital status should not be included in a resume (for most cultures).
Multiple email addresses were found in the contact information. Only one email address should be included in a resume.
Every section should have a clear, unambiguous, commonly-used header on a separate line directly above the content associated with it.

ResumeMetadata.PlainText:
CURRICULUM VITAE

(a)	PERSONAL DETAILS

   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  
Address: University of Nairobi, CHS
   ~~~~~~~~  , Nairobi
• telephone:    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  
• e-mail:    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   or    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~  
   ~~~~~~~  
   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  
Languages Spoken: English, Kiswahili and Kiembu
   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  
Next of Kin: Wamuyu Muriithi
P.oBox 1176, EMBU
   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~  


(b)	CAREER OBJECTIVES
To achieve the best out of my potential as a Teacher, Educational Researcher,
Manager and Planner so that the society obtains both qualitative and quantitative
education. To apply research knowledge to solve challenges faced by the educational
sector in Kenya and globally. To disseminate research findings in available fora and
to prepare quality materials for teacher education and for training educational
managers.

(c)	PERSONAL STATEMENT
I believe in hard work and integrity. I am committed to my work. I am an optimist and
a perfectionist. I don t give up until I achieve the objectives met.

(d)	EDUCATION BACKGROUND

Period	 Institution	Certificate Obtained

1999-2004: University of Nairobi - Master of Education (M.Ed)(Administration &
Planning)
1990-1995: University of Nairobi - B.Ed (arts) Hons Degree
1986-1989: Kangaru School	- KCSE Certificate
1978-1985: Kianjuki Pri. School - KCPE Certificate

(e)	WORK EXPERIENCE

(i) 2012-Todate: Assistant Registrar University of Nairobi
Key Tasks
• Deputizing the College Registrar
• Servicing the College Management Board and its Committees.
• Servicing the College Academic Board and its Committees.
• Preparing briefs for the Principal
• Performance Contract College Champion

and pensions, resignations, industrial relations, retirement, allowances, etc.

printing, and supervision of College transport services.
•   Interpretation and implementation of University regulations and rules,
labour laws and other statutory requirements
•   Any other official duties as may be directed by my seniors

(ii)	2003-2012: Assistant Registrar and Lecturer- Kagumo Teachers
Training College

(Department of Education)

• As a lecturer in the Department of Education my main duties were:-

administration, Research methods in Education, Educationalfinance,
General Teaching Methods and Communication and Technology in
education.
Am also involved in assessment of students on teaching practice among
other duties

(iii)	1996-1999

Position: Deputy Headteacher/ Teacher

Key Tasks
• As a Deputy Headteacher my key duties were:-
In charge of maintenance of student s discipline, deputizing the
headteacher,
Secretary to staff meetings, preparation of master tuition time table and
teaching
Staff duty roster, supervision of classes and the work of the prefects.
• As a class room teacher my key duties were:-
Taught and prepared candidates for examinations, marked examinations
and facilitated remedial teaching.

(f)	  PART TIME WORK

(i) 2007-2011
Employer: KenyaMethodistUniversity (KEMU)

Ireri s CV
Position: Part-time lecturer
Key Tasks
• Teaching and examining students in education courses in the Bachelor of
Education (B.Ed) programme. Courses taught include Educational
Administration and Management, General Teaching Methods and
Educational Communication and Technology
• Teaching and examining students in Business research methods in the
Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA) programme.
• Supervision of BBA and MBA students in research proposal development
and in projects/ theses writing. I supervised to completion the following
students in the MBA programme:

1) Nguru, R.G(2009):A study on access to Dental Health Services in rural
areas- A systems management approach: A case study of Kimahuri sub
location in Nyeri District
2) Nderitu Flora(2009): Constraints facing the implementation of Free
Secondary Education In Nyeri Central District
3) Muhoro Priscilla(2010):An analysis of the strategies adopted by public
transport SACCOs to gain a competitive advantage in the market. A
comparative study of 2 NK and 4NTE SACCOs in Nyeri district.

(g)	2004- 2012

Employer: University of Nairobi
Position: Part-Time Lecturer

Key Tasks
• Teaching and examining courses like Research Methods and Human
Resource Management
• Supervising students in development of research proposal and writing
reports / projects.
• At the University of Nairobi, I have supervised to completion many
Students in Development of Project proposal and compilation of projects
reports.

(h)	Research Works

• 2009/2010: Coordinated a research entitled: constraints facing the
management of the Teaching Practice in Kagumo Teachers
College (on-going)

• 2008/2009: Coordinated research entitled trainees perception ontraining
in Diploma Teacher Education: a case study of mathematics
graduates from Kagumo College in Nyeri
District

• 2002: I undertook a research entitled science teachers perception
of headteachers leadership styles and girls performance in
KCSE sciences in public schools in Embu district. Done in

Ireri s CV
partial fulfillment of an award of a Master of Education
(M.Ed) thesis.

•	1996 (2 months): Worked as a Research Assistant during a food Security
Survey- Diocese of Embu.

•	1995(1 month): Worked as a research assistant during early Retirement
Enumeration survey

•	1990(2 months): Worked as a research assistant during postCensus
Enumeration survey

(i)	PROFFESIONAL ACHIEVEMENTS
• 2012- Chairman, Strategic Plan, Monitoring and Evaluation & Vision
2030 Flagship Projects- Kagumo TTC.

•	2008 Chairman Research and Development committee at Kagumo
College. The committee conducts various research works for the college
and disseminates the research findings in organized forums in college.

•	In 2008, I co-authored a handbook of Education for Kenya Institute of
Education (KIE).

•	In 2008 I got involved in planning and designing a 5 years strategic plan
for KagumoTeachers College.

•	The Kenya Institute of Education (KIE) in 2007 and 2008 involved me in
the development of Diploma Teacher Education (DTE) syllabus. I also got
appointed a course panelist for Diploma Teacher Education and Adult
Education programmes.

•	Between 2004 to date I have supervised more than twenty projects/theses
at the diploma, degree and masters levels at the University of Nairobi and
at the Kenya Methodist University.

•	In March 2010, I got appointed as KNEC examiner specifically got trained
to mark Diploma Teacher Education (DTE) education Examination.

(j)	ON THE JOB TRAINING COURSES

•	In 2012, I got trained and examined in Internal Quality Auditing on ISO
   ~~~~~   Standard and got certified as an ISO Internal Quality Auditor.

•	In 2011, I was trained and certified as a Trainer of Trainers (ToT) by
Inoorero University on IBTM (ICT Based Teaching and Information
management) course

•	In 2011, I was trained in ISO 9001:2008 standard, specifically on Quality
Management Systems, implementation and procedures documentation.

•	In 2011, I was trained as a Master Trainer by Intel Multinational Company
on Intel teach program, Getting started course (using 21 st Century skills
Ireri s CV
in education) after which I trained 120 tutors of Kagumo Teachers
Training College.

•	In 2011, Trained as a Trainer of Trainers under the Academy for
Education and Development (AED) program sponsored by USAID on ICT
integration in teaching and learning. Consequently, trained 40 Secondary
school Teachers and Kagumo college tutors on the same.

•	In 2010, I was trained as a master trainer under the Academy for
Education and Development (AED) program sponsored by USAID.
Consequently, in January 2011 I trained 120 college tutors under Teacher
Education and Professional Development (TEPD) program.

•	In June, 2010 I attended a Ministry of Education capacity building
workshop at KagumoCollege. Topics covered were: Work ethics and
Ethos, Curriculum Management and Supervision, Resource
Management, Operation Effective 60, Discipline in Schools, Teacher
Management,	Assessment	and	Evaluation,	Financial
Management/Procurement procedures, Stress management, Effective
Communication and Results based management.

•	In 2003 I attended a workshop on Distance Education, Open Learning
and e-Learning for Teacher Education at the Kenya Institute of Education
(KIE).Topics covered were: Qualities of a good teacher, Developing
distance education courses, Elements of a good DE, Open learning and
e-learning modes, Developing teaching/learning materials for distance
education, DE course design, DE technology and DE course
management and administration

•	In 2004, I attended a workshop on Attitude Change and Hands on
Activities under the Strengthening of Mathematics and Sciences in
Secondary Schools (SMASSE) programme.

(k)	COMPUTER KNOWLEDGE

• In 2012 I obtained a CISCO certificate on IT Essentials: PC Hardware and
Software from CISCO Networking Academy.

•	In December 2011, Obtained a Trainers of Trainers Certificate on ICT
Based Teaching and Information Management (IBTM) course at Inoorero
University. The following courses were offered: Integration of ICT in
classroom practice, Dititized lesson plans, schemes of Work and Exams,
Storage of Instructional materials, Open SIS, Customizing students
information systems, Animation and Simulation.

•	In November 2011, I obtained a certificate of Master Trainer from Intel
Company on Getting Started course, ICT integration in teaching and
Learning. The following courses were covered:21 st Century Skills,
Introduction to Computers, Word Processing, Multi Media, Spreadsheets
and internet.


Ireri s CV
•	In April 2011, I was trained as master trainer by USAID on ICT
integration in Teaching and Learning. Topics covered included:
Introduction to Computers, Ms Word Processing, Ms Power point, Ms
Excel and internet.

•	In July 2002, I obtained a certificate from the University of Nairobi on
computer proficiency course which covered: Introduction to computers,
ms word and Internet.

(l)	RESPONSIBILITIES
• 2005-2012: An assistant registrar in charge of tuition programmesat
KagumoCollege.
• 2005-2006: Assistant Zone Co-Ordinator (Nakuru-Baringo Zone) for
Teaching Practice at KagumoCollege.
• I have also served as a coach (football) at Kagumo TTC.
• 1998-1999: Deputy Headteacher at Karangare Secondary School.
• In December 2007: Presiding Officer under the Electoral Commission of
Kenya.
• In August 2010: Presiding Officer under the IIEC during the Constitution of
Kenya referendum

(m) MEMBERSHIP

Committee
•	2009-2012: Kagumo Teachers College ISO Implementation Committee
•	2005-2012: Kagumo Teacher College Academic and Examinations
Board
•	2005-2012: Kagumo Teachers College Graduation Central Committee
•	2012-2012: Chairman, Kagumo Teachers College Strategic Plan
Committee
•	2007-2011: Chairman, Kagumo Teachers College Research and
Development sub committee
•	2009-todate: Administration Director: Kirimari group Ltd


(n)	HOBBIES

My hobbies are watching football, playing pool and chess, filling crossword
puzzles, reading magazines and journals, Discussing Issues, watching TV and
driving.
